text_logic_form: Point $M$ is the midpoint of one of the legs of the trapezoid.
Point $P$ is the midpoint of the other leg of the trapezoid.
The length of the line $QR$ is $16$ units.
The length of the line $PM$ is $12$ units.
The length of the line $TS$ is $4x$ units.
dissolved_text_logic_form: Point $M$ is the midpoint of one of the legs of the trapezoid.
Point $P$ is the midpoint of the other leg of the trapezoid.
The length of the line $QR$ is $16$ units.
The length of the line $PM$ is $12$ units.
The length of the line $TS$ is $4x$ units.
diagram_logic_form: Point $P$ lies on the line connecting $Q$ and $T$.
Point $M$ lies on the line connecting $R$ and $S$.
line_instances: There are lines $MS$, $PM$, $QP$, $QR$, $QT$, $RM$, $RS$, $TP$, and $TS$, forming the trapezoid and its sides.
The lines $MS$ and $PM$ are the legs of the trapezoid $QRST$.
The lines $QP$ and $TS$ are the bases of the trapezoid $QRST$.
The lines $QR$ and $RT$ are the diagonals of the trapezoid $QRST$.
